job_title: Engineer Modeling & Validation of Wind Turbine Simulation Models
company_name: Fraunhofer Institute for Wind Energy Systems IWES
job_responsibilities: Develop validation methods for offshore wind turbines, research suitable methods, implement them in Python, and evaluate them on test benches.
Model and simulate offshore wind turbines.
Contribute to further development of existing MoWiT (Modelica Library for Wind Turbines) models.
Be responsible for the setup (including design basis and design load cases) and evaluation of MoWiT simulations.
Generate synthetic simulation data and compare it with measurement data from test benches and wind turbines.
Document findings and results in academic publications and present them at conferences and trade fairs.
Support project acquisitions by conducting research.
job_requirements: Completed diploma or master’s degree with a focus on wind energy.
Experience in wind turbine simulation, modeling, and programming (e.g., Modelica, Python, or C) from studies or practical work placements.
Knowledge in offshore wind turbines, such as hydrodynamics and wave theories, is a plus.
Knowledge of methods for verification and validation, ideally in offshore wind energy, is desired but not mandatory.
job_location: Bremerhaven, Germany (Fraunhofer IWES site); option for remote work
job_type: Fixed-term (3 years), Full-time or Part-time (preferably close to full-time), 39 hours/week, Public-sector collective wage agreement (TVöD), Remote work possible
experience_level: Entry-level to Intermediate (recent graduates with practical experience encouraged)
salary_info: Appointment, remuneration and social security benefits based on the public-sector collective wage agreement (TVöD). Performance-based variable remuneration components may be granted.
language_requirements: Good command of German and English
